doc.title: Strength Across the Board, FY26 Guidance Lift
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-28/Pure Storage Inc. Strength Across the Board FY26 Guidance LiftPure Storage Inc. Strength Across the Board FY26 Guidance _2025-08-28

passages.text: Top- line, TCV, and margins all came in ahead of expectations with the META collaboration continuing on track. META initiated its first volume deployment with PSTG in the Q, and the company noted increased interest from other hyperscalers. FY top- line guidance lift with 2H GM acceleration expected.

PSTG posted a solid Q on top- line, mix, TCV, and margins in the Q. Evergreen//One TCV came in at \(\) 125M\(up 24\% y / y\) and \(>30\% q / q\) with the velocity segment (deals \(< 5M\) ) driving the outperformance. Despite the strength in the Q, we note the metric can be variable and swing Q to Q. Management continues to expect growth of Evergreen//One this year. Product GMs came in ahead of expectations, up 400bps q/q with mix across hardware/software and products, as well as salesforce adjustments helping to drive the beat. We expect 2H acceleration in both product and services GMs.

Macro and secular demand trends both positive in the Q. META relationship is continuing as expected, and PSTG continues to assume deployment of 1- 2 exabytes of DirectFlash technology and potentially more by FY end. The company recognized revenue this past Q on the deployments that have begun, though we expect revenue this past Q and the remainder of 2H revenue to be de minimis. Recall, this deal is not expected to meaningfully contribute to revenue until FY27 (CY26), and will be licensing/support services (no hardware in sales) and will reside in the Products segment. Management highlighted an acceleration in interest from other hyperscalers, though no new wins were announced.

In light of the outperformance in the Q, as well as improving secular and macro demand trends heading into 2H, management raised FY top- line guidance from 11% to 14% at the midpoint. 17% OM still expected for the year, given the investments required for the META deal, though management called out the sales team's efficiency in holding value and discounting discipline this Q (which was part of the margin issue last Q). Management did not see any change in linearity in the Q, beyond higher volumes from demand strength.

- The numbers. Revenue of \(\) 861M\(beat our estimate by 2\% (product driven), and EPS of\) \ \(0.43\) came in above our \(\) 0.35\(estimate. GM of\) 72.1\% \(came in above our estimate, with both product and Subscription Services margins coming in higher than expected. OM of\) 15.1\% \(slightly ahead of our\) 14.8\% \(expectations.
Please see analyst certifications and important disclosures beginning on page 4. Completed: 28- Aug- 25, 11:46 GMT Released: 28- Aug- 25, 11:47 GMT Restricted - External

- **Positives.** Product GM moved higher Q/Q, with customers moving towards higher end solutions. Additionally sales force management of pricing/discounting discipline also helped overall GM. Though management did not mention commodity costs being a driver in margin improvement, we expect moderation of QLC flash pricing to boost product GMs through the year. Evergreen//One TCV surprised to the upside this Q, driven by high velocity deals, and management continues to expect growth this year (though acknowledges TCV can be variable). Management continues to have conversations with hyperscalers, though nothing yet to announce. The META relationship is progressing as expected with management highlighting potential for more than 1-2 exabytes this year. Although the macro environment continues to be dynamic, management lifted FY top-line guidance on the strength in the Q and positive secular demand they are seeing. Notably, both US and International regions saw q/q and y/y strength in the quarter.

- **Concerns.** Despite the outperformance in TCV in the Q, companies' preference between aaS and traditional sales can be variable with large deals swinging the metric from Q to Q as well. Revenue from the META deal this year is expected to be de minimis, though this has already been well telegraphed to the Street. Despite the GM outperformance the ~17% FY OM guidance was maintained.

**Estimates and rating.** We adjust our estimates for FY26-27 to account for the better than expected GM in the Q and strength in Evergreen//One, as well as the broader business. We move our PT to $70, from $57, based on 5.5x (up from 4.5x) our FY27 revenue estimate of $4.0Bn (up from $3.9Bn). We remain Equal Weight as we believe the increased valuation already reflects new opportunities in AI and with hyperscalers.

S: This issuer is a Corporate Broker to Barclays PLC.
U: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include subordinate voting restricted shares.
V: The equity securities of this Canadian issuer include non- voting restricted shares.
Overweight - The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Equal Weight - The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Underweight - The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a 12- month investment horizon.
Positive - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are improving.
Neutral - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.
Negative - industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are deteriorating.

Valuation Methodology: We rate PSTG Equal Weight with a price target of \(\) 70\$ . Our price target assumes the stock trades at an EV/sales multiple of 5.5x our FY27e revenue estimate. This multiple represents a premium to the peer group of lower- growth, legacy peers.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Valuation and Price Target: 1) Large enterprise. We like the investment in large enterprise, but the timing and sustainability of positive outcomes is uncertain. 2) Competition. Pure led AFA early, but others caught up. Next others will try to close the gap in AI and NVMe. 3) Valuation. We view valuation as attractive, but as EPS- based valuation becomes more important, Pure will have to demonstrate better operating leverage.

Sustainable Investing Related Research: There is currently no globally accepted framework or definition (legal, regulatory or otherwise) of, nor market consensus as to what constitutes a 'sustainable', 'ESG', 'green', 'climate- friendly' or an equivalent company, investment, strategy or consideration or what precise attributes are required to be eligible to be categorised by such terms. This means there are different ways to evaluate a company or an investment and so different values may be placed on certain sustainability credentials as well as adverse ESG- related impacts of companies and ESG controversies. The evolving nature of sustainable investing considerations, models and methodologies means it can be challenging to definitively and universally classify a company or investment under a sustainable investing label and there may be areas where such companies and investments could improve or where adverse ESG- related impacts or ESG controversies exist. The evolving nature of sustainable finance related regulations and the development of jurisdiction- specific regulatory criteria also means that there is likely to be a degree of divergence as to the interpretation of such terms in the market. We expect industry guidance, market practice, and regulations in this field to continue to evolve.

Any information, data, image, or other content including from a third party source contained, referred to herein or used for whatsoever purpose by Barclays or a third party ("Information"), in relation to any actual or potential 'ESG', 'sustainable' or equivalent objective, issue, factor or consideration is not intended to be relied upon for ESG or sustainability classification, regulatory regime or industry initiative purposes ("ESG Regimes"), unless otherwise stated.
